page.title: 09THE ELDERLY
page.content: We interviewed several elderly people in our area to discover how they cope with life in 1985. Most people we interviewed were quite happy with the facilities for the elderly within Sittingbourne. We discovered, however, that there are several kinds of old people's homes. Several homes in the area combined independence with care and supervision. Others, however, forced the elderly to live in very close proximity and this caused anxiety and unhappiness in some. A few went to the local club which arranges outings and talks for the elderly but this we felt lacked variety and few bothered to attend. Their main complaints were the traffic and the bus fares which they thought should be cheaper. A few wanted the Age Concern to do more and some regretted that there are no nearby hospitals.
